snippet: KOEPPEL--Noel Immanuel, died peacefully in New York on June 20, 2016. Born in 1930, he served in the Korean War as a First Lieutenant in the Navy. He earned an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, and became Vice Presiden...
lead_paragraph: KOEPPEL--Noel Immanuel, died peacefully in New York on June 20, 2016. Born in 1930, he served in the Korean War as a First Lieutenant in the Navy. He earned an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, and became Vice President of E. Koeppel, Inc., an automobile dealership founded by his father in 1931. Since 1977 to the time of his death, he worked as a financial planner. He was passionate about New York, automobiles, and classical music. He is survived by his children, Thomas Koeppel, Elizabeth Botvin and Roberta Koeppel Foss; and his sister, Sandra Halpern. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  KOEPPEL, NOEL IMMANUEL
